intro: Ruagea surutuensis, commonly known as the Surutuensis or a type of tropical tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforest and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in folk medicine for their purported health benefits. Ruagea surutuensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
